intro: Trachymene lanceolata var. typica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed false solomon's seal, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in spring. Its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional medicine by Indigenous communities. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or shady environments.
